sentences.sentence: Now a telomere is a highly repetitious and genetically meaningless sequence of DNA, what we were calling junk DNA.
sentences.translation: 端粒是高度重复的，从基因上来说没有意义的 DNA 序列，我们称之为垃圾 DNA。

sentences.sentence: Every time the Chromosome divides—every time one cell divides into two—pieces of the ends of the Chromosome, the telomere, get broken off.
sentences.translation: 当每次染色体分裂时——即当每次一个细胞分裂成两个时——染色体的尾部，也就是端区，就会发生断裂。

sentences.sentence: Anyway, if we examine these ends of these coils of DNA, we will find a sequence of DNA at each end of every human Chromosome, called a telomere.
sentences.translation: 无论如何，如果我们检查这些螺旋状 DNA 的末端，我们会发现每条人类染色体的末端都有一个被称作“端粒”的 DNA 序列。
